title: Microsoft#039;s New iPhone App Makes Doing This One Thing So Much Easier
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
28 Sep 2015 02:49 AM EST 
Weeks after Microsoft surprised everyone by making an unexpected appearance during Apple's iPhone 6S reveal, the company has released another standalone iPhone app: Invite. The latest out of Microsoft's experimental "Garage" team, Invite is meant to make it easier for people to schedule meetings, regardless of what type of email account you have. The people you invite don't need to have the app installed to respond. However, though those who do can add the finalized times to their calendars and exchange messages about the meeting within the app.
